intro: Dysphania rhadinostachya, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Dysphania rhadinostachya is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar climbing or trailing growth habits.
